intro: Argostemma maquilingense, commonly known as the Philippine starleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticulture and conservation efforts.
